content.description:
A Big Rock test-piece! Can be top-roped.

 Start on a boulder leaning against the wall. Might be advisable to stick clip. Get onto the face and start making the thin moves riding the slashes. Intense finger moves and small foot placements make up the meat of the route. A hard transition move gets you to the vertical crack and a couple of gear placements.
content.protection: QD's for bolts and a light rack. Can be TR'ed by rappelling a tree to the lower set of anchors.
content.location: The lower tower. Look for the slashes that face west.

climbs.name: Meth Face aka Shadow Boxing
climbs.fa: Tom Caldwell, Nathan Brown, Andrew Hancox, FFA Greg Ramsey

content.description:
A sustained crimp fest up a near vertical wall on gorgeous crystals and edges. Starts with a V4/5 move and then stays on you until you reach the large horizontal break.

 You can either start by jumping from a small boulder to the first jug rail or use the tree to stem you way up. A big piece can be placed at the first horizontal, or skip it and make the easy moves to the first bolt. Make a hard V4/5 deadpoint move at the first bolt. Stick the decently sized crimp and clip the second bolt. Continue traversing left to some larger rails and clip the third bolt. Make another hard move up using the crystal ball. Some thin and techy moves out right lead to the next bolt at a crimp rail. Make another tough deadpoint on bad feet to get into the horizontal break. From here the route takes gear to the top. Place a couple of thin pieces in the crack in the groove. Place one last piece of gear in the crack. Pull the bulge to anchors.

 Can easily be TR'ed from the anchors at the top. Use the ring-less hangers to get to the lower set of anchors.
content.protection: QD's for bolts, thin to finger sized cams, nuts optional.
content.location: This is the upper tower closest to the main wall. It faces due south, so wait for a cloud cold day to send.

content.description: These two free standing towers are home to the toughest routes at Big Rock. High quality face climbing on some fierce finger test-pieces, good luck!
